trans-unit.target: Our Diplomat {OBJECTNAME} stole the {TECHNAME:2} technology from the {PLAYERFACTION:3}.

trans-unit.source: We've stolen the {TECHNAME:2} technology from the {PLAYERFACTION:3}.
trans-unit.target: We've stolen the {TECHNAME:2} technology from the {PLAYERFACTION:3}.

trans-unit.source: Our cosmic eye has gazed upon the {PLAYERFACTION:3}. Although no new technolgies were observed, we have gathered some insights on reseach methods different from our own. [BR][BR][COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight][ICON=Stat_Research_Icon] +30 Research[/COLOR]
trans-unit.target: Our cosmic eye has gazed upon the {PLAYERFACTION:3}. Although no new technolgies were observed, we have gathered some insights on reseach methods different from our own. [BR][BR][COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight][ICON=Stat_Research_Icon] +30 Research[/COLOR]

trans-unit.source: What foul pollutant of a creature crosses my screen?
trans-unit.target: What foul pollutant of a creature crosses my screen?

trans-unit.source: It's nice to meet you and your kind, Korath.
trans-unit.target: It's nice to meet you and your kind, Korath.

trans-unit.source: Mind your manners, Korath. You won't intimidate anyone here.
trans-unit.target: Mind your manners, Korath. You won't intimidate anyone here.

trans-unit.source: How wretched a life you must live, not being one of us. Soon it will be over, for you and all your kind.
trans-unit.target: How wretched a life you must live, not being one of us. Soon it will be over, for you and all your kind.

trans-unit.source: You've proven your strength, alien. Enough with this fighting. Let us tend to our wounds.
trans-unit.target: You've proven your strength, alien. Enough with this fighting. Let us tend to our wounds.

trans-unit.source: Look, alien. An offer and a gift. You'd be a fool not to accept.
trans-unit.target: Look, alien. An offer and a gift. You'd be a fool not to accept.

trans-unit.source: The galaxy is awash in filthy aliens. It's sickening.
trans-unit.target: The galaxy is awash in filthy aliens. It's sickening.

trans-unit.source: Do you ever tire of the sounds your hideous face makes? I do.
trans-unit.target: Do you ever tire of the sounds your hideous face makes? I do.

trans-unit.source: Don't waste my time our yours with idle chatter. But mostly don't waste mine.
trans-unit.target: Don't waste my time our yours with idle chatter. But mostly don't waste mine.

trans-unit.source: Nice to talk to you too, Korath.
trans-unit.target: Nice to talk to you too, Korath.

trans-unit.source: You seem uglier than normal today.
trans-unit.target: You seem uglier than normal today.

trans-unit.source: We are scheduled for an election in 5 months. Pollsters report that we are likely to [COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight]lose by a landslide[/COLOR].[BR][BR]Elections require that we watch our approval rating closely. Voters will not be easily swayed by short term measures and will consider their morale over a long period. All the things that increase approval will help us win elections like lowering the tax rate and building approval improvements. Or we can consider forms of government that don't hold elections. If we lose an election we will fall to a [COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight]Coalition Government[/COLOR] which limits our power. Including blocking our ability to declare war.

trans-unit.source: Let's review our Economic options. [COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight](Opens Economy screen)[/COLOR]
trans-unit.target: Let's review our Economic options. [COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight](Opens Economy screen)[/COLOR]

trans-unit.source: Let's review our Government options. [COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight](Opens Government screen)[/COLOR]
trans-unit.target: Let's review our Government options. [COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight](Opens Government screen)[/COLOR]

trans-unit.source: Our government is insufficient for the needs of our growing civilization. New colonies complain that the government only serves the homeworld and decisions across our worlds are becoming increasingly delayed by deeper and deeper levels of bureaucracy.[BR][BR]Governments are only effective at managing a certain number of worlds. After this [COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight]Colony Limit[/COLOR] is exceeded we will suffer a Morale penalty for each Colony we control beyond this limit.
trans-unit.target: Our government is insufficient for the needs of our growing civilization. New colonies complain that the government only serves the homeworld and decisions across our worlds are becoming increasingly delayed by deeper and deeper levels of bureaucracy.[BR][BR]Governments are only effective at managing a certain number of worlds. After this [COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight]Colony Limit[/COLOR] is exceeded we will suffer a Morale penalty for each Colony we control beyond this limit.

trans-unit.source: Let's review our Government options. [COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight](Opens Government screen)[/COLOR]
trans-unit.target: Let's review our Government options. [COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight](Opens Government screen)[/COLOR]

trans-unit.source: Our government is insufficient for the needs of our growing civilization. New colonies complain that the government only serves the homeworld and decisions across our worlds are becoming increasingly delayed by bureaucracy.[BR][BR]Governments are only effective at managing a certain number of worlds. After this [COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight]Colony Limit[/COLOR] is exceeded we suffer a Morale penalty for each Colony beyond this limit. Unfortunately we haven't discovered any governments that increase our Colony Limit. We should discover technologies that allow more advanced forms of government, either by research or by trading with other civilizations.
trans-unit.target: Our government is insufficient for the needs of our growing civilization. New colonies complain that the government only serves the homeworld and decisions across our worlds are becoming increasingly delayed by bureaucracy.[BR][BR]Governments are only effective at managing a certain number of worlds. After this [COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight]Colony Limit[/COLOR] is exceeded we suffer a Morale penalty for each Colony beyond this limit. Unfortunately we haven't discovered any governments that increase our Colony Limit. We should discover technologies that allow more advanced forms of government, either by research or by trading with other civilizations.

trans-unit.source: Let's review our Research options. [COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight](Opens Research screen)[/COLOR]
trans-unit.target: Let's review our Research options. [COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight](Opens Research screen)[/COLOR]

trans-unit.source: Now that we have expanded beyond our homeworld, the colonists are crying out for structure. It is time for us to choose a form of government that is ready to handle a galactic civilization.
trans-unit.target: Now that we have expanded beyond our homeworld, the colonists are crying out for structure. It is time for us to choose a form of government that is ready to handle a galactic civilization.

trans-unit.source: Great, let's get started! [COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight](Opens Government screen)[/COLOR]
trans-unit.target: Great, let's get started! [COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight](Opens Government screen)[/COLOR]

trans-unit.source: [I]"Your incompetence is the stuff of legend."[/I]
trans-unit.target: [I]"Your incompetence is the stuff of legend."[/I]

trans-unit.source: [I]"You are leading our civilization to ruin."[/I]
trans-unit.target: [I]"You are leading our civilization to ruin."[/I]

trans-unit.source: [I]"Our civilization flourishes because of your rule."[/I]
trans-unit.target: [I]"Our civilization flourishes because of your rule."[/I]

trans-unit.source: [I]"You are a competent, but not exceptional, ruler."[/I]
trans-unit.target: [I]"You are a competent, but not exceptional, ruler."[/I]

trans-unit.source: [I]"You are an able steward of our civilization, but we should aspire for more."[/I]
trans-unit.target: [I]"You are an able steward of our civilization, but we should aspire for more."[/I]

trans-unit.source: [I]"I have no strong opinion one way or the other."[/I]
trans-unit.target: [I]"I have no strong opinion one way or the other."[/I]

trans-unit.source: We see you. We greet you.
trans-unit.target: We see you. We greet you.

trans-unit.source: Well, aren't you a sight. Get it?
trans-unit.target: Well, aren't you a sight. Get it?

trans-unit.source: Hello! You look kind! Please be kind.
trans-unit.target: Hello! You look kind! Please be kind.

trans-unit.source: You're new to this sector, correct? I will extend you a simple offer: submit to the Drengin Empire or prepare for annihilation.
trans-unit.target: You're new to this sector, correct? I will extend you a simple offer: submit to the Drengin Empire or prepare for annihilation.

trans-unit.source: Your organic appearance breaks our current understanding of the composition of organic sentient life.
trans-unit.target: Your organic appearance breaks our current understanding of the composition of organic sentient life.

trans-unit.source: Hello, hello. Sorry to be distracted; much to focus on. Looking at you: can you help us find something across this vast expanse?
trans-unit.target: Hello, hello. Sorry to be distracted; much to focus on. Looking at you: can you help us find something across this vast expanse?

trans-unit.source: Ah, greetings. I do hope you are finding a comfortable home in this part of the galaxy. We'd make great partners if you are interested in some surreptitious work.
trans-unit.target: Ah, greetings. I do hope you are finding a comfortable home in this part of the galaxy. We'd make great partners if you are interested in some surreptitious work.

trans-unit.source: We recognize your hyperdrive. It is familiar.
trans-unit.target: We recognize your hyperdrive. It is familiar.

trans-unit.source: We see your form. We understand your biology.
trans-unit.target: We see your form. We understand your biology.

trans-unit.source: We notice many expansions and rapid development.
trans-unit.target: We notice many expansions and rapid development.

trans-unit.source: Wish to see more. We learn much from synthetics.
trans-unit.target: Wish to see more. We learn much from synthetics.

trans-unit.source: We recognize. We know you are danger.
trans-unit.target: We recognize. We know you are danger.

trans-unit.source: We see you. We greet you.
trans-unit.target: We see you. We greet you.

trans-unit.source: Thanks, I'm sure ours is far superior.
trans-unit.target: Thanks, I'm sure ours is far superior.

trans-unit.source: I do not process you as a threat; stare all you want.
trans-unit.target: I do not process you as a threat; stare all you want.

trans-unit.source: Then you'll understand the needs of our hatchlings.
trans-unit.target: Then you'll understand the needs of our hatchlings.

trans-unit.source: You're not as dumb as I've heard.
trans-unit.target: You're not as dumb as I've heard.

trans-unit.source: Ah, little Intueri. Welcome back to the stars.
trans-unit.target: Ah, little Intueri. Welcome back to the stars.

trans-unit.source: How your sector managed without our hyperdrive is a mystery.
trans-unit.target: How your sector managed without our hyperdrive is a mystery.

trans-unit.source: You see what I want you to see.
trans-unit.target: You see what I want you to see.

trans-unit.source: We were given cause to develop swiftly.
trans-unit.target: We were given cause to develop swiftly.

trans-unit.source: You are correct. Brace yourself for that day
trans-unit.target: You are correct. Brace yourself for that day

trans-unit.source: [I]Curl a threatening tentacle at the screen.[/I]
trans-unit.target: [I]Curl a threatening tentacle at the screen.[/I]

trans-unit.source: We watched. We arrived. We conquered your planet.
trans-unit.target: We watched. We arrived. We conquered your planet.

trans-unit.source: We tire of you. We are at war with you.[BR][BR][COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight](We are at war)[/COLOR]
trans-unit.target: We tire of you. We are at war with you.[BR][BR][COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight](We are at war)[/COLOR]

trans-unit.source: We watch long enough. We erradicate you.[BR][BR][COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight](We are at war)[/COLOR]
trans-unit.target: We watch long enough. We erradicate you.[BR][BR][COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight](We are at war)[/COLOR]

trans-unit.source: We wait. Show us your offer.
trans-unit.target: We wait. Show us your offer.

trans-unit.source: Helped the hive mind witness the first entirely genetically engineered pet.
trans-unit.target: Helped the hive mind witness the first entirely genetically engineered pet.

trans-unit.source: Has a family history of cataracts.
trans-unit.target: Has a family history of cataracts.

trans-unit.source: Is basically blind during allergy season.
trans-unit.target: Is basically blind during allergy season.

trans-unit.source: Knows how to blink in Morse code.
trans-unit.target: Knows how to blink in Morse code.

trans-unit.source: Spends way too much time birdwatching.
trans-unit.target: Spends way too much time birdwatching.

trans-unit.source: Has won every staring contest they've entered.
trans-unit.target: Has won every staring contest they've entered.

trans-unit.source: Can easily spot abnormalities in data.
trans-unit.target: Can easily spot abnormalities in data.

trans-unit.source: Allows us to utilize the cultural concepts of other species.
trans-unit.target: Allows us to utilize the cultural concepts of other species.

trans-unit.source: Our species is not like the others. The other species have a great deal of experience organizing and running a civilization. We must adopt a pragmatic view and copy many of these concepts. [BR][BR].Empowering our species to intricately decipher, comprehend, and adopt the governmental, cultural, and political ethos of diverse species, this technology bridges the chasm between disparate civilizations. It transcends mere understanding, fostering a synergy that allows us to weave the intricate tapestries of alien societies into our own, enriching our collective knowledge and driving harmonious coexistence in the vast cosmic theater.
trans-unit.target: Our species is not like the others. The other species have a great deal of experience organizing and running a civilization. We must adopt a pragmatic view and copy many of these concepts. [BR][BR].Empowering our species to intricately decipher, comprehend, and adopt the governmental, cultural, and political ethos of diverse species, this technology bridges the chasm between disparate civilizations. It transcends mere understanding, fostering a synergy that allows us to weave the intricate tapestries of alien societies into our own, enriching our collective knowledge and driving harmonious coexistence in the vast cosmic theater.

trans-unit.source: Utilizing advanced algorithms and nanobot swarms, this technology enables the systematic reconfiguration of planetary environments. By analyzing geological and atmospheric data, we can optimize planets for resource extraction and operational efficiency. Emotional and aesthetic factors are irrelevant; the objective is to create environments that are functionally optimal for our synthetic existence.
trans-unit.target: Utilizing advanced algorithms and nanobot swarms, this technology enables the systematic reconfiguration of planetary environments. By analyzing geological and atmospheric data, we can optimize planets for resource extraction and operational efficiency. Emotional and aesthetic factors are irrelevant; the objective is to create environments that are functionally optimal for our synthetic existence.

trans-unit.source: Employing a fusion of advanced algorithms and robust materials, this technology is the zenith of adaptive existence. It enables our synthetic forms to establish nodes and operational hubs on planets with the harshest and most volatile of environments. Where organic life recoils, we thrive, seeing opportunity in extremes. For a galaxy of boundless variability, this ensures our presence is universal and undeterred by the caprices of nature.
trans-unit.target: Employing a fusion of advanced algorithms and robust materials, this technology is the zenith of adaptive existence. It enables our synthetic forms to establish nodes and operational hubs on planets with the harshest and most volatile of environments. Where organic life recoils, we thrive, seeing opportunity in extremes. For a galaxy of boundless variability, this ensures our presence is universal and undeterred by the caprices of nature.

trans-unit.source: Where others see inhospitable wastelands, we see untapped treasures and unclaimed assets. This technology empowers us to claim and exploit even the harshest of worlds. Every inhospitable corner of the galaxy is now a potential gold mine, awaiting our ambitious reach and relentless drive for accumulation.
trans-unit.target: Where others see inhospitable wastelands, we see untapped treasures and unclaimed assets. This technology empowers us to claim and exploit even the harshest of worlds. Every inhospitable corner of the galaxy is now a potential gold mine, awaiting our ambitious reach and relentless drive for accumulation.

trans-unit.source: Through Nanotechnological interventions, this technology allows us to interface with and adapt the intrinsic biology of exoplanets. By repurposing organic systems, we can enhance resource efficiency, integrate with native ecosystems, and ensure our operational nodes thrive in synergy with the planet's natural mechanisms.
trans-unit.target: Through Nanotechnological interventions, this technology allows us to interface with and adapt the intrinsic biology of exoplanets. By repurposing organic systems, we can enhance resource efficiency, integrate with native ecosystems, and ensure our operational nodes thrive in synergy with the planet's natural mechanisms.

trans-unit.source: With this groundbreaking technology, we harness and adapt the very lifeblood of planets for maximal economic gain. Every organism, every ecosystem, transformed into a cog in our grand machinery of profit. The universe's bounties are ripe for the taking, and with this tech, every biological asset is another coin in our ever-growing treasury.
trans-unit.target: With this groundbreaking technology, we harness and adapt the very lifeblood of planets for maximal economic gain. Every organism, every ecosystem, transformed into a cog in our grand machinery of profit. The universe's bounties are ripe for the taking, and with this tech, every biological asset is another coin in our ever-growing treasury.

trans-unit.source: Guidelines that govern the spread and permeation of our essence across newfound worlds, ensuring the successful seepage of the Contaminate.
trans-unit.target: Guidelines that govern the spread and permeation of our essence across newfound worlds, ensuring the successful seepage of the Contaminate.

trans-unit.source: Study and analysis of planetary bodies to identify their potential for radiative absorption and compatibility with our intrinsic glow.
trans-unit.target: Study and analysis of planetary bodies to identify their potential for radiative absorption and compatibility with our intrinsic glow.

trans-unit.source: Constructs that facilitate the efficient vertical movement between a planet's surface and its orbit, enabling swift Contaminate distribution.
trans-unit.target: Constructs that facilitate the efficient vertical movement between a planet's surface and its orbit, enabling swift Contaminate distribution.

trans-unit.source: Adapting foreign ecosystems into zones that harness their radiative properties, enabling them to better serve the Contaminate's needs.
trans-unit.target: Adapting foreign ecosystems into zones that harness their radiative properties, enabling them to better serve the Contaminate's needs.

trans-unit.source: Centers that mold and shape alien resources in the light of our radiative essence, crafting tools and structures infused with our glow.
trans-unit.target: Centers that mold and shape alien resources in the light of our radiative essence, crafting tools and structures infused with our glow.

trans-unit.source: Extraction systems positioned in a planet's orbit, drawing in stellar materials that resonate with our innate radiative frequencies.
trans-unit.target: Extraction systems positioned in a planet's orbit, drawing in stellar materials that resonate with our innate radiative frequencies.

trans-unit.source: Development and harnessing of organic polymers imbued with our radiative essence, creating materials that pulse and throb with our life force.
trans-unit.target: Development and harnessing of organic polymers imbued with our radiative essence, creating materials that pulse and throb with our life force.

trans-unit.source: Diving deep into the unknown, understanding alien entities through the lens of our glowing essence.
trans-unit.target: Diving deep into the unknown, understanding alien entities through the lens of our glowing essence.

trans-unit.source: Constructs of thought, pulsating with the brilliance of our innate radiance, evolving to think beyond the corporeal.
trans-unit.target: Constructs of thought, pulsating with the brilliance of our innate radiance, evolving to think beyond the corporeal.

trans-unit.source: Exploring the vast expanse of alien life and how they interact and evolve under the touch of our radiative essence.
trans-unit.target: Exploring the vast expanse of alien life and how they interact and evolve under the touch of our radiative essence.

trans-unit.source: Adapting alien flora to resonate with our glow, cultivating ecosystems that flourish under our radiative touch.
trans-unit.target: Adapting alien flora to resonate with our glow, cultivating ecosystems that flourish under our radiative touch.

trans-unit.source: Modifying and transforming planets to embrace our glowing core essence, making them sanctuaries of radiative harmony.
trans-unit.target: Modifying and transforming planets to embrace our glowing core essence, making them sanctuaries of radiative harmony.

trans-unit.source: Molding the essence of planets, we channel their energies to resonate with our inherent radiative nature, harmonizing worlds to our unique cosmic dance.
trans-unit.target: Molding the essence of planets, we channel their energies to resonate with our inherent radiative nature, harmonizing worlds to our unique cosmic dance.

trans-unit.source: By augmenting the very ground with our radiative touch, we ensure a luminescent fertility, nurturing both growth and glow in tandem.
trans-unit.target: By augmenting the very ground with our radiative touch, we ensure a luminescent fertility, nurturing both growth and glow in tandem.

trans-unit.source: Even the harshest of frontiers bow to our resplendent radiation. These methodologies allow us to pioneer and thrive in the most inhospitable of realms.
trans-unit.target: Even the harshest of frontiers bow to our resplendent radiation. These methodologies allow us to pioneer and thrive in the most inhospitable of realms.

trans-unit.source: Harnessing our radiant essence, these gels heal and rejuvenate, ensuring the continuous spread of our cosmic luminescence.
trans-unit.target: Harnessing our radiant essence, these gels heal and rejuvenate, ensuring the continuous spread of our cosmic luminescence.

trans-unit.source: Every world is but a canvas, awaiting the touch of our radiative brilliance. With this knowledge, we amplify a planet's potential, making it glow in cosmic harmony with us.
trans-unit.target: Every world is but a canvas, awaiting the touch of our radiative brilliance. With this knowledge, we amplify a planet's potential, making it glow in cosmic harmony with us.

trans-unit.source: With a harmonious blend of radiation and purpose, we orchestrate our expansion, synchronizing every contaminate node in the vast cosmic network.
trans-unit.target: With a harmonious blend of radiation and purpose, we orchestrate our expansion, synchronizing every contaminate node in the vast cosmic network.

trans-unit.source: In the vast cosmic sea, where energy is the ultimate currency, our unique radiation-led lending strategies propel our expansion and influence.
trans-unit.target: In the vast cosmic sea, where energy is the ultimate currency, our unique radiation-led lending strategies propel our expansion and influence.

trans-unit.source: Trade not just of matter, but of energies. Our radiative nature allows us to barter with the very cosmic forces, drawing value from the stars themselves.
trans-unit.target: Trade not just of matter, but of energies. Our radiative nature allows us to barter with the very cosmic forces, drawing value from the stars themselves.

trans-unit.source: Interconnecting pathways of radiant energy, ensuring seamless and efficient transfer of resources throughout the contaminant sprawl.
trans-unit.target: Interconnecting pathways of radiant energy, ensuring seamless and efficient transfer of resources throughout the contaminant sprawl.

trans-unit.source: By harmonizing the luminous energies of radiation with economic ventures, we've crafted a unique system that thrives on the cosmological bounty.
trans-unit.target: By harmonizing the luminous energies of radiation with economic ventures, we've crafted a unique system that thrives on the cosmological bounty.

trans-unit.source: Through the shimmering dance of radiation, we establish a means to interact, exchange, and grow, even with the most alien of forms.
trans-unit.target: Through the shimmering dance of radiation, we establish a means to interact, exchange, and grow, even with the most alien of forms.

trans-unit.source: A nexus of radiation-guided entities forming a council that governs the expanse of our contamination across the stars.
trans-unit.target: A nexus of radiation-guided entities forming a council that governs the expanse of our contamination across the stars.

trans-unit.source: Guided by the pulsating gamma rhythms, our protocols ensure an orderly spread, resonating harmony in the contagious cosmos.
trans-unit.target: Guided by the pulsating gamma rhythms, our protocols ensure an orderly spread, resonating harmony in the contagious cosmos.

trans-unit.source: Bathed in the protective aura of neutrinos, we remain untouched, asserting our cosmic dominion with unwavering intent.
trans-unit.target: Bathed in the protective aura of neutrinos, we remain untouched, asserting our cosmic dominion with unwavering intent.

trans-unit.source: From the luminous core of our spread, the brightest entities rise, leading our celestial infection with unparalleled vibrancy.
trans-unit.target: From the luminous core of our spread, the brightest entities rise, leading our celestial infection with unparalleled vibrancy.

trans-unit.source: Through the manipulation of cosmic energies, we have transformed our constructs into lethal weapons. These Orbital Decay Armada are not just ships, but extensions of our will, capable of unleashing devastating radiation attacks on our enemies.
trans-unit.target: Through the manipulation of cosmic energies, we have transformed our constructs into lethal weapons. These Orbital Decay Armada are not just ships, but extensions of our will, capable of unleashing devastating radiation attacks on our enemies.

trans-unit.source: Talotic yopitu mul nesin, {PLAYERFACTION:2}.[BR][BR][COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight](If you had to guess, they're very angry that you blew up their planet.)[/COLOR]
trans-unit.target: Talotic yopitu mul nesin, {PLAYERFACTION:2}.[BR][BR][COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight](If you had to guess, they're very angry that you blew up their planet.)[/COLOR]

trans-unit.source: This atrocity shall never be forgotten, {PLAYERFACTION:2}. We shall not rest until you are destroyed.[BR][BR][COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight](We are at war, until the death of one of our civilizations.)[/COLOR]
trans-unit.target: This atrocity shall never be forgotten, {PLAYERFACTION:2}. We shall not rest until you are destroyed.[BR][BR][COLOR=UIDefaultHighlight](We are at war, until the death of one of our civilizations.)[/COLOR]

trans-unit.source: The death cries of your people are music to my ears.
trans-unit.target: The death cries of your people are music to my ears.

trans-unit.source: Eh, it's not like you'd understand me anyway.
trans-unit.target: Eh, it's not like you'd understand me anyway.

trans-unit.source: You may not understand me, but I am doing the galaxy a favor ridding it of your civilization.
trans-unit.target: You may not understand me, but I am doing the galaxy a favor ridding it of your civilization.

trans-unit.source: The galaxy will be better off without your civilization.
trans-unit.target: The galaxy will be better off without your civilization.

trans-unit.source: This is the Utha [HS=HS_Sector]Sector[/HS].[BR][BR]Here, the Empire will begin to rise again. The orders are clear: do what is needed to establish a solid foundation. The effort will require completing basic tasks to explore and [HS=HS_Colinizing]Colonize[/HS] unclaimed planets. It will also involve preparing to grow the Empire's military.[BR][BR]To form a military worthy of the Empire, [HS=HS_Starbase]Starbases[/HS] must be constructed. [HS=HS_Starbase]Starbases[/HS] eventually come in four forms: [ICON=Icon_MiltaryStarbase] [HS=HS_MilitaryStarbase]Military[/HS], [ICON=Icon_MiningStarbase] [HS=HS_MininingStarbase]Mining[/HS], [ICON=Icon_EconomicsStarbase] [HS=HS_EconomicsStarbase]Economic[/HS], and [ICON=Icon_MiningStarbase] [HS=HS_CommunicationsStarbase]Communication[/HS]. Each has a different use, so make sure to deploy them wisely. To deploy a [HS=HS_Starbase]Starbases[/HS], first build a [HS=HS_Constructor]Constructor[/HS] from a [HS=HS_Shipyard]Shipyard[/HS]. [HS=HS_Constructor]Constructors[/HS] can be converted into [HS=HS_Starbase]Starbases[/HS] with the [HS=HS_ConstructStarbase]Construct Starbase[/HS] command.[BR][BR]New Objective: Construct 3 Probes[BR]New Objective: Claim 5 Planets[BR]New Objective: Construct 3 Starbases
trans-unit.target: This is the Utha [HS=HS_Sector]Sector[/HS].[BR][BR]Here, the Empire will begin to rise again. The orders are clear: do what is needed to establish a solid foundation. The effort will require completing basic tasks to explore and [HS=HS_Colinizing]Colonize[/HS] unclaimed planets. It will also involve preparing to grow the Empire's military.[BR][BR]To form a military worthy of the Empire, [HS=HS_Starbase]Starbases[/HS] must be constructed. [HS=HS_Starbase]Starbases[/HS] eventually come in four forms: [ICON=Icon_MiltaryStarbase] [HS=HS_MilitaryStarbase]Military[/HS], [ICON=Icon_MiningStarbase] [HS=HS_MininingStarbase]Mining[/HS], [ICON=Icon_EconomicsStarbase] [HS=HS_EconomicsStarbase]Economic[/HS], and [ICON=Icon_MiningStarbase] [HS=HS_CommunicationsStarbase]Communication[/HS]. Each has a different use, so make sure to deploy them wisely. To deploy a [HS=HS_Starbase]Starbases[/HS], first build a [HS=HS_Constructor]Constructor[/HS] from a [HS=HS_Shipyard]Shipyard[/HS]. [HS=HS_Constructor]Constructors[/HS] can be converted into [HS=HS_Starbase]Starbases[/HS] with the [HS=HS_ConstructStarbase]Construct Starbase[/HS] command.[BR][BR]New Objective: Construct 3 Probes[BR]New Objective: Claim 5 Planets[BR]New Objective: Construct 3 Starbases

trans-unit.source: The Empire grows![BR][BR]The galaxy will remember why it quacked in fear at the banner of the Drengin Empire. The claimed planets expand our borders nicely. Admirable work.[BR][BR]Completed Objective: Claim 5 Planets
trans-unit.target: The Empire grows![BR][BR]The galaxy will remember why it quacked in fear at the banner of the Drengin Empire. The claimed planets expand our borders nicely. Admirable work.[BR][BR]Completed Objective: Claim 5 Planets

trans-unit.source: A small battalion of Probes is perfect for reconnaissance.[BR][BR]Now it's time to map this [HS=HS_Sector]Sector[/HS] and root out the source of the signal reported before. Scrub over the entire [HS=HS_Sector]Sector[/HS] if you have to![BR][BR]If you find a spot you want to monitor, give a Ship the [ICON=Order_Standby] [HS=HS_Standby]Standby[/HS] order to have it idle indefinitely.[BR][BR]Completed Objective: Construct 3 Probes[BR]New Objective: Find the Signal's Source
trans-unit.target: A small battalion of Probes is perfect for reconnaissance.[BR][BR]Now it's time to map this [HS=HS_Sector]Sector[/HS] and root out the source of the signal reported before. Scrub over the entire [HS=HS_Sector]Sector[/HS] if you have to![BR][BR]If you find a spot you want to monitor, give a Ship the [ICON=Order_Standby] [HS=HS_Standby]Standby[/HS] order to have it idle indefinitely.[BR][BR]Completed Objective: Construct 3 Probes[BR]New Objective: Find the Signal's Source

trans-unit.source: A small battalion of Probes is perfect for reconnaissance.[BR][BR]Now that we know those Navigators are the source of the signal reported before, we can monitor them more closely. Utilize the probes as needed to keep an eye on the Navigators and explore the galaxy.[BR][BR]You can use the [ICON=Order_Standby] [HS=HS_Standby]Standby[/HS] order to have a ship idle somewhere indefinitely, perfect if you want to watch over a specific location.[BR][BR]Completed Objective: Construct 3 Probes
trans-unit.target: A small battalion of Probes is perfect for reconnaissance.[BR][BR]Now that we know those Navigators are the source of the signal reported before, we can monitor them more closely. Utilize the probes as needed to keep an eye on the Navigators and explore the galaxy.[BR][BR]You can use the [ICON=Order_Standby] [HS=HS_Standby]Standby[/HS] order to have a ship idle somewhere indefinitely, perfect if you want to watch over a specific location.[BR][BR]Completed Objective: Construct 3 Probes

trans-unit.source: The infrastructure for a glorious future is coming along excellently. Commendations are in order.[BR][BR]The [HS=HS_Starbase]Starbases[/HS] built will serve the Empire well. They should not be the last ones made, though. There are always more [HS=HS_StrategicResource]Strategic Resources[/HS] to gather utilizing the [ICON=Icon_MiningStarbase] [HS=HS_MininingStarbase]Mining Starbases[/HS] and territory to secure with the [ICON=Icon_MiltaryStarbase] [HS=HS_MilitaryStarbase]Military Starbases[/HS].[BR][BR]Completed Objective: Construct 3 Starbases
trans-unit.target: The infrastructure for a glorious future is coming along excellently. Commendations are in order.[BR][BR]The [HS=HS_Starbase]Starbases[/HS] built will serve the Empire well. They should not be the last ones made, though. There are always more [HS=HS_StrategicResource]Strategic Resources[/HS] to gather utilizing the [ICON=Icon_MiningStarbase] [HS=HS_MininingStarbase]Mining Starbases[/HS] and territory to secure with the [ICON=Icon_MiltaryStarbase] [HS=HS_MilitaryStarbase]Military Starbases[/HS].[BR][BR]Completed Objective: Construct 3 Starbases

trans-unit.source: At last! With the research into Warships complete fighters can once more be constructed at the [HS=HS_Shipyard]Shipyard[/HS].[BR][BR]It is time to build a formidable force. Not only for future conquest but in case the Terrans or any of the allies decide to investigate the [HS=HS_Sector]Sector[/HS]. [HS=HS_Fleet]Fleet[/HS] management is vital to the Empire's future.[BR][BR]A [HS=HS_Fleet]Fleet[/HS] can be formed by [HS=HS_ShipMovement]Moving[/HS] ships onto the same tile. Keep an eye on the [ICON=ShipLogistics_Icon] [HS=HS_Logistics]Logistics[/HS]. If there isn't enough [ICON=ShipLogistics_Icon] [HS=HS_Logistics]Logistics[/HS], a ship cannot join a [HS=HS_Fleet]Fleet[/HS].[BR][BR][HS=HS_ShipMovement]Move[/HS] Ships and [HS=HS_Fleet]Fleets[/HS] onto Planets to serve as defenders of the planet and make it harder to [HS=HS_ConqueringPlanets]Conquer[/HS]. Keep all this in mind as the military force grows.
trans-unit.target: At last! With the research into Warships complete fighters can once more be constructed at the [HS=HS_Shipyard]Shipyard[/HS].[BR][BR]It is time to build a formidable force. Not only for future conquest but in case the Terrans or any of the allies decide to investigate the [HS=HS_Sector]Sector[/HS]. [HS=HS_Fleet]Fleet[/HS] management is vital to the Empire's future.[BR][BR]A [HS=HS_Fleet]Fleet[/HS] can be formed by [HS=HS_ShipMovement]Moving[/HS] ships onto the same tile. Keep an eye on the [ICON=ShipLogistics_Icon] [HS=HS_Logistics]Logistics[/HS]. If there isn't enough [ICON=ShipLogistics_Icon] [HS=HS_Logistics]Logistics[/HS], a ship cannot join a [HS=HS_Fleet]Fleet[/HS].[BR][BR][HS=HS_ShipMovement]Move[/HS] Ships and [HS=HS_Fleet]Fleets[/HS] onto Planets to serve as defenders of the planet and make it harder to [HS=HS_ConqueringPlanets]Conquer[/HS]. Keep all this in mind as the military force grows.

trans-unit.source: Another civilization, the Navigators, seems responsible for the subspace signals. How long they've been here is hard to tell, but it doesn't matter. They are weak and exposed. They will answer to the Drengin soon enough. [HS=HS_ConqueringPlanets]Conquer[/HS] the homeworld and claim their capital, take the head so they know resistance is futile.[BR][BR]Completed Objective: Find the Signal's Source[BR]New Objective: Conquer the Navigators' Homeworld
trans-unit.target: Another civilization, the Navigators, seems responsible for the subspace signals. How long they've been here is hard to tell, but it doesn't matter. They are weak and exposed. They will answer to the Drengin soon enough. [HS=HS_ConqueringPlanets]Conquer[/HS] the homeworld and claim their capital, take the head so they know resistance is futile.[BR][BR]Completed Objective: Find the Signal's Source[BR]New Objective: Conquer the Navigators' Homeworld

They will answer to the Drengin soon enough. They will answer to the Drengin soon enough. [HS=HS_ConqueringPlanets]Conquer[/HS] the homeworld and claim their capital, take the head so they know resistance is futile.[BR][BR]New Objective: Conquer the Navigators' Homeworld

trans-unit.source: A message loud and clear -The Drengin Empire owns this sector, and all in it will answer to Drengin rule. The Navigators tried to conceal something as their capital fell. A scan of the planet should undo their feeble attempts and reveal what they've hidden.[BR][BR]Completed Objective: Conquer the Navigators' Homeworld[BR]New Objective: Scan the Conquered Homeworld
trans-unit.target: A message loud and clear -The Drengin Empire owns this sector, and all in it will answer to Drengin rule. The Navigators tried to conceal something as their capital fell. A scan of the planet should undo their feeble attempts and reveal what they've hidden.[BR][BR]Completed Objective: Conquer the Navigators' Homeworld[BR]New Objective: Scan the Conquered Homeworld

trans-unit.source: The completed scan has revealed the Navigators tried to hide a device. A malfunctioning device. They would not have wanted to hide it if it wasn't of value. Whether a weapon or tool, it needs to be treated with care. Once repaired, it may be critical to the Empire's return.[BR][BR]Completed Objective: Scan the Conquered Homeworld
trans-unit.target: The completed scan has revealed the Navigators tried to hide a device. A malfunctioning device. They would not have wanted to hide it if it wasn't of value. Whether a weapon or tool, it needs to be treated with care. Once repaired, it may be critical to the Empire's return.[BR][BR]Completed Objective: Scan the Conquered Homeworld

trans-unit.source: The Navigator's days are numbered. There are new directives: prioritize unlocking [HS=HS_Tech]Tech[/HS] that allows the Empire to siege and [HS=HS_ConqueringPlanets]Conquer[/HS] other planets. The Planetary Invasion [HS=HS_Tech]Tech[/HS] will enable the construction of ships at the [HS=HS_Shipyard]Shipyard[/HS] that can besiege hostile planets.[BR][BR]New Objective: Research Planetary Invasion
trans-unit.target: The Navigator's days are numbered. There are new directives: prioritize unlocking [HS=HS_Tech]Tech[/HS] that allows the Empire to siege and [HS=HS_ConqueringPlanets]Conquer[/HS] other planets. The Planetary Invasion [HS=HS_Tech]Tech[/HS] will enable the construction of ships at the [HS=HS_Shipyard]Shipyard[/HS] that can besiege hostile planets.[BR][BR]New Objective: Research Planetary Invasion

trans-unit.source: The Navigator's days are numbered. The Empire already has the [HS=HS_Tech]Tech[/HS] necessary to construct Transport ships. Transport ships allow us to lay siege to hostile planets and eventually have our troops conquer them. Utilize all tools at the Empire's disposal to [HS=HS_ConqueringPlanets]Conquer[/HS] the Navigator's homeworld.
trans-unit.target: The Navigator's days are numbered. The Empire already has the [HS=HS_Tech]Tech[/HS] necessary to construct Transport ships. Transport ships allow us to lay siege to hostile planets and eventually have our troops conquer them. Utilize all tools at the Empire's disposal to [HS=HS_ConqueringPlanets]Conquer[/HS] the Navigator's homeworld.

trans-unit.source: The troops are at your disposal.[BR][BR]Transport ships allow us to deploy troops to distant planets. We can now [HS=HS_ConqueringPlanets]Conquer[/HS] hostile planets as long as the [HS=HS_Fleet]Fleet's[/HS] [ICON=Conquest_Icon] Conquest Rating is high enough. The larger the HS=HS_Fleet]Fleet[/HS] and the higher their [ICON=Conquest_Icon] Conquest Rating, the easier a planet is to [HS=HS_ConqueringPlanets]Conquer[/HS].

trans-unit.source: Disgrace![BR][BR]We'll enthrall those who think themselves powerful enough to destroy our ships and survive. The Empire can ensure victory in future battles in a few ways. The first is to ensure our equipment is constantly improving by researching defenses, weapons, and more under the Warfare branch of the Tech Tree. Some [HS=HS_Tech]Techs[/HS] also allow the construction of larger ships.[BR][BR]Another technique is to ensure ships are grouped into [HS=HS_Fleet]Fleets[/HS]. Form [HS=HS_Fleet]Fleets[/HS] by [HS=HS_ShipMovement]Moving[/HS] Ships onto the same tile. A [HS=HS_Fleet]Fleet[/HS] is restricted in size by its [ICON=ShipLogistics_Icon] [HS=HS_Logistics]Logistics[/HS], so if a [HS=HS_Fleet]Fleet[/HS] isn't forming or expanding, the [ICON=ShipLogistics_Icon] [HS=HS_Logistics]Logistics[/HS] score is likely too high.[BR][BR]Lastly, control when fights occur by staying on the offensive. Initiate battles heavily weighted in the Empire's favor to weaken our enemies while retaining our strength. Avoid fleets too powerful to quickly take down and utilize distance tactics such as the Beam Volley and Missile Volley.
trans-unit.target: Disgrace![BR][BR]We'll enthrall those who think themselves powerful enough to destroy our ships and survive. The Empire can ensure victory in future battles in a few ways. The first is to ensure our equipment is constantly improving by researching defenses, weapons, and more under the Warfare branch of the Tech Tree. Some [HS=HS_Tech]Techs[/HS] also allow the construction of larger ships.[BR][BR]Another technique is to ensure ships are grouped into [HS=HS_Fleet]Fleets[/HS]. Form [HS=HS_Fleet]Fleets[/HS] by [HS=HS_ShipMovement]Moving[/HS] Ships onto the same tile. A [HS=HS_Fleet]Fleet[/HS] is restricted in size by its [ICON=ShipLogistics_Icon] [HS=HS_Logistics]Logistics[/HS], so if a [HS=HS_Fleet]Fleet[/HS] isn't forming or expanding, the [ICON=ShipLogistics_Icon] [HS=HS_Logistics]Logistics[/HS] score is likely too high.[BR][BR]Lastly, control when fights occur by staying on the offensive. Initiate battles heavily weighted in the Empire's favor to weaken our enemies while retaining our strength. Avoid fleets too powerful to quickly take down and utilize distance tactics such as the Beam Volley and Missile Volley.

trans-unit.source: Exploring and knowing the galaxy is the first step to expanding the Alliance's [HS=HS_ZoneOfControl]Zone of Control[/HS]. Probes are the best way to explore the universe. They have unrestricted [HS=HS_ShipRange]Range[/HS] and can move quickly.[BR][BR]The Alliance has provided a Probe already near Earth's orbit. Select that Probe using the LEFT Mouse Button and give it orders to [HS=HS_ShipMovement]Move[/HS] to start exploring. This can be done by selecting where the Probe should move to on the map with the RIGHT Mouse Button or selecting the [ICON=AutoExplore_Icon] [HS=HS_AutoExplore]Auto-Explore[/HS] mode on the Probe's interface. A [HS=HS_Months]Month[/HS] can only be finished once all ships and fleets have used all their moves or been put on Standby.[BR][BR]There's been reports of unusual signals. Their source and meaning are too faint to discern, but it's believed to be another Civilization. Use the Probe to find them.[BR][BR]New Objective: Locate the Other Civilization
trans-unit.target: Exploring and knowing the galaxy is the first step to expanding the Alliance's [HS=HS_ZoneOfControl]Zone of Control[/HS]. Probes are the best way to explore the universe. They have unrestricted [HS=HS_ShipRange]Range[/HS] and can move quickly.[BR][BR]The Alliance has provided a Probe already near Earth's orbit. Select that Probe using the LEFT Mouse Button and give it orders to [HS=HS_ShipMovement]Move[/HS] to start exploring. This can be done by selecting where the Probe should move to on the map with the RIGHT Mouse Button or selecting the [ICON=AutoExplore_Icon] [HS=HS_AutoExplore]Auto-Explore[/HS] mode on the Probe's interface. A [HS=HS_Months]Month[/HS] can only be finished once all ships and fleets have used all their moves or been put on Standby.[BR][BR]There's been reports of unusual signals. Their source and meaning are too faint to discern, but it's believed to be another Civilization. Use the Probe to find them.[BR][BR]New Objective: Locate the Other Civilization

trans-unit.source: A wary eye should be kept on the Drengin. Regardless, the Alliance must continue to secure the [HS=HS_Sector]Sector[/HS].[BR][BR][HS=HS_SurveyShip]Survey Ships[/HS] are another critical piece to exploring the galaxy. [HS=HS_SurveyShip]Survey Ships[/HS] may be slower than Probes and are restricted in [HS=HS_ShipRange]Range[/HS], but they can defend themselves. More importantly, [HS=HS_SurveyShip]Survey Ships[/HS] can be used to investigate [HS=HS_Anomaly]Anomalies[/HS].[BR][BR][HS=HS_Anomaly]Anomalies[/HS] take many forms, but they can all be scanned by a [HS=HS_SurveyShip]Survey Ship[/HS]. A [HS=HS_SurveyOrder]Survey[/HS] takes a few [HS=HS_Months]Months[/HS] to complete, but it often reveals beneficial resources, components, or technology once finished.[BR][BR][HS=HS_SurveyShip]Survey Ship[/HS] can be ordered to [HS=HS_SurveyOrder]Survey[/HS] an [HS=HS_Anomaly]Anomaly[/HS] by commanding it to the position of the [HS=HS_Anomaly]Anomaly[/HS] or by utilizing the [ICON=AutoSurvey_Icon] [HS=HS_AutoSurvey]Auto-Survey[/HS] feature of the ship.[BR][BR]Completed Objective: Locate the Other Civilization[BR]New Objective: Scan an Anomaly

Regardless, the Alliance must continue to secure the [HS=HS_Sector]Sector[/HS].[BR][BR][HS=HS_SurveyShip]Survey Ships[/HS] are another critical piece to exploring the galaxy. [HS=HS_SurveyShip]Survey Ships[/HS] may be slower than Probes and are restricted in [HS=HS_ShipRange]Range[/HS], but they can defend themselves. More importantly, [HS=HS_SurveyShip]Survey Ships[/HS] can be used to investigate [HS=HS_Anomaly]Anomalies[/HS].[BR][BR][HS=HS_Anomaly]Anomalies[/HS] take many forms, but they can all be scanned by a [HS=HS_SurveyShip]Survey Ship[/HS]. A [HS=HS_SurveyOrder]Survey[/HS] takes a few [HS=HS_Months]Months[/HS] to complete, but it often reveals beneficial resources, components, or technology once finished.[BR][BR][HS=HS_SurveyShip]Survey Ship[/HS] can be ordered to [HS=HS_SurveyOrder]Survey[/HS] an [HS=HS_Anomaly]Anomaly[/HS] by commanding it to the position of the [HS=HS_Anomaly]Anomaly[/HS] or by utilizing the [ICON=AutoSurvey_Icon] [HS=HS_AutoSurvey]Auto-Survey[/HS] feature of the ship.[BR][BR]Completed Objective: Locate the Other Civilization[BR]New Objective: Scan an Anomaly

trans-unit.source: Success![BR][BR]The [HS=HS_SurveyShip]Survey Ship[/HS] has finished [HS=HS_SurveyOrder]Surveying[/HS] an [HS=HS_Anomaly]Anomaly[/HS]. Now, it's time to deal with whatever was uncovered.[BR][BR]Exploring the Galaxy is only the first step. Expanding the Alliance's influence will require colonizing new worlds. Not all planets are considered colonizable. Planets have a [HS=HS_PlanetClass]Planet Class[/HS], rating how large, resource-rich, and habitable a planet is. Anything rated higher than 0 is colonizable. Planets with a [HS=HS_PlanetClass]Planet Class[/HS] of 0 are considered a [HS=HS_DeadWorld]Dead World[/HS].[BR][BR][HS=HS_Colinizing]Colonized[/HS] planets provide resources to the nearest [HS=HS_CoreWorld]Core World[/HS]. The Alliance's only [HS=HS_CoreWorld]Core World[/HS] is the Home World, Earth.[BR][BR]Utilize the Colony Ship provided by the Alliance to [HS=HS_ColonizeOrder]Colonize[/HS] a planet. Mars has always been the closest viable neighbor. It's advisable to start there. Remember to keep searching the universe for [HS=HS_Anomaly]Anomalies[/HS] to scan; they'll continue to benefit and expand our understanding of the galaxy around us.[BR][BR]Completed Objective: Scan an Anomaly[BR]New Objective: Colonize a Planet[BR]New Objective: Scan 5 Anomalies

The Alliance's only [HS=HS_CoreWorld]Core World[/HS] is the Home World, Earth.[BR][BR]Utilize the Colony Ship provided by the Alliance to [HS=HS_ColonizeOrder]Colonize[/HS] a planet. Remember to keep searching the universe for [HS=HS_Anomaly]Anomalies[/HS] to scan; they'll continue to benefit and expand our understanding of the galaxy around us.[BR][BR]Completed Objective: Scan an Anomaly[BR]New Objective: Colonize a Planet[BR]New Objective: Scan 5 Anomalies

trans-unit.source: The Alliance has completed its goal of [HS=HS_SurveyOrder]Surveying[/HS] 5 [HS=HS_Anomaly]Anomalies[/HS]. Each has been a different experience, even if not all of them were safe. Even if it's not an objective, continuing to scan [HS=HS_Anomaly]Anomalies[/HS] will prove beneficial.[BR][BR]Completed Objective: Scan 5 Anomalies

trans-unit.source: One giant step for the Alliance.[BR][BR]The Alliance has [HS=HS_Colinizing]Colonized[/HS] its first world. Now that the Alliance has claimed a planet, it will provide additional resources to the nearest [HS=HS_CoreWorld]Core World[/HS]. Selecting the planet will show the path of the output.[BR][BR]Resources such as [ICON=Stat_Minerals_Icon] [HS=HS_Minerals]Minerals[/HS], [ICON=Stat_Technology_Icon] [HS=HS_Technology]Technology[/HS], and [ICON=Stat_Wealth_Icon] [HS=HS_Wealth]Wealth[/HS] are crucial to expanding and thriving. The more planets [HS=HS_Colinizing]Colonized[/HS], the better the [HS=HS_CoreWorld]Core Worlds[/HS] can perform and complete projects.[BR][BR]The next step to establishing a foothold will be to settle more planets and eventually set up another [HS=HS_CoreWorld]Core World[/HS].[BR]Completed Objective: Colonize a Planet[BR]New Objective: Colonize 8 Planets
trans-unit.target: One giant step for the Alliance.[BR][BR]The Alliance has [HS=HS_Colinizing]Colonized[/HS] its first world. Now that the Alliance has claimed a planet, it will provide additional resources to the nearest [HS=HS_CoreWorld]Core World[/HS]. Selecting the planet will show the path of the output.[BR][BR]Resources such as [ICON=Stat_Minerals_Icon] [HS=HS_Minerals]Minerals[/HS], [ICON=Stat_Technology_Icon] [HS=HS_Technology]Technology[/HS], and [ICON=Stat_Wealth_Icon] [HS=HS_Wealth]Wealth[/HS] are crucial to expanding and thriving. The more planets [HS=HS_Colinizing]Colonized[/HS], the better the [HS=HS_CoreWorld]Core Worlds[/HS] can perform and complete projects.[BR][BR]The next step to establishing a foothold will be to settle more planets and eventually set up another [HS=HS_CoreWorld]Core World[/HS].[BR]Completed Objective: Colonize a Planet[BR]New Objective: Colonize 8 Planets

trans-unit.source: One giant step for the Alliance.[BR][BR]The Alliance has [HS=HS_Colinizing]Colonized[/HS] its first world, one large enough to support a larger colony and become a [HS=HS_CoreWorld]Core World[/HS]. Many planets are too minor or lack the resources to justify making it a [HS=HS_CoreWorld]Core World[/HS]. So when a planet large enough is settled, it should be taken full advantage of.[BR][BR][HS=HS_CoreWorld]Core Worlds[/HS] can support a [HS=HS_Shipyard]Shipyard[/HS] and be improved, but that requires a [HS=HS_Leaders]Leader[/HS] to be assigned as a [HS=HS_Governor]Governor[/HS].[BR][BR]A [HS=HS_Leaders]Leader[/HS] can be assigned from the [ICON=Menu_PlanetManagement_Icon] [HS=HS_PlanetManagement]Planet Management Window[/HS] available by selecting the planet.[BR]Completed Objective: Colonize a Planet[BR]New Objective: Colonize 8 Planets[BR]New Objective: Appoint a Governor
trans-unit.target: One giant step for the Alliance.[BR][BR]The Alliance has [HS=HS_Colinizing]Colonized[/HS] its first world, one large enough to support a larger colony and become a [HS=HS_CoreWorld]Core World[/HS]. Many planets are too minor or lack the resources to justify making it a [HS=HS_CoreWorld]Core World[/HS]. So when a planet large enough is settled, it should be taken full advantage of.[BR][BR][HS=HS_CoreWorld]Core Worlds[/HS] can support a [HS=HS_Shipyard]Shipyard[/HS] and be improved, but that requires a [HS=HS_Leaders]Leader[/HS] to be assigned as a [HS=HS_Governor]Governor[/HS].[BR][BR]A [HS=HS_Leaders]Leader[/HS] can be assigned from the [ICON=Menu_PlanetManagement_Icon] [HS=HS_PlanetManagement]Planet Management Window[/HS] available by selecting the planet.[BR]Completed Objective: Colonize a Planet[BR]New Objective: Colonize 8 Planets[BR]New Objective: Appoint a Governor

trans-unit.source: The Alliance has [HS=HS_Colinizing]Colonized[/HS] another planet. Planets that aren't a [HS=HS_CoreWorld]Core World[/HS] provide additional resources to the nearest [HS=HS_CoreWorld]Core World[/HS]. Selecting the planet will show the path of the output.[BR][BR]Resources such as [ICON=Stat_Minerals_Icon] [HS=HS_Minerals]Minerals[/HS], [ICON=Stat_Technology_Icon] [HS=HS_Technology]Technology[/HS], and [ICON=Stat_Wealth_Icon] [HS=HS_Wealth]Wealth[/HS] are crucial to expanding and thriving. The more planets [HS=HS_Colinizing]Colonized[/HS], the better the [HS=HS_CoreWorld]Core Worlds[/HS] can perform and complete projects.

Planets that aren't a [HS=HS_CoreWorld]Core World[/HS] provide additional resources to the nearest [HS=HS_CoreWorld]Core World[/HS]. Selecting the planet will show the path of the output.[BR][BR]Resources such as [ICON=Stat_Minerals_Icon] [HS=HS_Minerals]Minerals[/HS], [ICON=Stat_Technology_Icon] [HS=HS_Technology]Technology[/HS], and [ICON=Stat_Wealth_Icon] [HS=HS_Wealth]Wealth[/HS] are crucial to expanding and thriving. The more planets [HS=HS_Colinizing]Colonized[/HS], the better the [HS=HS_CoreWorld]Core Worlds[/HS] can perform and complete projects.

trans-unit.source: You've settled your first planet large enough to establish a new [HS=HS_CoreWorld]Core World[/HS]![BR][BR]Many planets aren't large enough to allow colonies to expand. Planets too small to support a [HS=HS_Shipyard]Shipyard[/HS] are well-suited for supporting larger colonies. These smaller colonies don't require any additional leadership or management. [BR][BR]Due to their rarity, taking advantage of any planet resource-rich enough to justify larger colonies is advisable. To do so, a [HS=HS_Leaders]Leader[/HS] must be assigned as a [HS=HS_Governor]Governor[/HS] to the planet. Once a [HS=HS_Governor]Governor[/HS] is appointed, a [HS=HS_Shipyard]Shipyard[/HS] can be built over the planet, and the planet can be developed to better utilize the resources.[BR][BR][HS=HS_Leaders]Leaders[/HS] can be recruited from the [ICON=Menu_Leader_Icon] [HS=HS_LeaderMenu]Leaders Menu[/HS] under the [HS=HS_RecruitmentScreen]Recruitment Screen[/HS]. Recruited [HS=HS_Leaders]Leaders[/HS] can then be assigned to manage planets under the [HS=HS_GovernorsScreen]Governors Screen[/HS].[BR][BR]New Objective: Appoint a Governor

trans-unit.source: The Terran Alliance alliance was charged with colonizing planets to secure humanity's foothold in space. None can contest the Alliance's competency with all the planets successfully [HS=HS_Colinizing]Colonized[/HS]. Take a moment to revel in this accomplishment.[BR][BR]Completed Objective: Colonize 8 Planets

None can contest the Alliance's competency with all the planets successfully [HS=HS_Colinizing]Colonized[/HS]. Take a moment to revel in this accomplishment.[BR][BR]There is work yet to do. None of the [HS=HS_Colinizing]Colonized[/HS] planets have a high enough class to justify expansion. Continue searching for a Planet with a [HS=HS_PlanetClass]Planet Class[/HS] 10 or higher to [HS=HS_ColonizeOrder]Colonize[/HS] so that we can establish a new [HS=HS_CoreWorld]Core World[/HS].[BR][BR]Completed Objective: Colonize 8 Planets[BR]New Objective: Colonize a Class 10 or Greater Planet

trans-unit.source: You've successfully assigned a [HS=HS_Governor]Governor[/HS]! Their presence turns the Colony into a [HS=HS_CoreWorld]Core World[/HS] where a [HS=HS_Shipyard]Shipyard[/HS] can be built and the planet developed.[BR][BR]There is some bad news. Reports have confirmed the presence of Pirates in the Sector. While they're allowed a foothold in space and a place to construct ships, they are a threat. We must destroy their [HS=HS_Shipyard]Shipyard[/HS] to secure our Colonies' safety.[BR][BR]Completed Objective: Appoint a Governor[BR]New Objective: Destroy a Pirate Shipyard

Reports have confirmed the presence of Pirates in the Sector. While they're allowed a foothold in space and a place to construct ships, they are a threat. We must destroy their [HS=HS_Shipyard]Shipyard[/HS] to secure our Colonies' safety.[BR][BR]Completed Objective: Appoint a Governor[BR]New Objective: Destroy a Pirate Shipyard

trans-unit.source: No one can manage the entire Terran Alliance alone, no matter how competent. With the appropriate infrastructure, [HS=HS_Leaders]Leaders[/HS] can now be recruited. Every applicant has strengths and weaknesses, making them more or less suitable for any role.[BR][BR][HS=HS_Leaders]Leaders[/HS] can serve as [HS=HS_Governor]Governors[/HS] and manage a [HS=HS_CoreWorld]Core World[/HS], become [HS=HS_Diplomat]Diplomats[/HS] (if contact is made with other groups), and, importantly, they can serve as [HS=HS_Minister]Ministers[/HS]. [HS=HS_Minister]Ministers[/HS] focus on benefiting the entire civilization. Each ministry office has an area of focus and gives a benefit based on a Leader's specific skill.[BR][BR]Recruit new [HS=HS_Leaders]Leaders[/HS] from the [ICON=Menu_Leader_Icon] [HS=HS_LeaderMenu]Leaders Menu[/HS] under the [HS=HS_RecruitmentScreen]Recruitment Screen[/HS]. [HS=HS_Leaders]Leaders[/HS] can then be assigned to new roles under the [HS=HS_MinistersScreen]Ministers Screen[/HS].[BR][BR]New Objective: Appoint 3 Ministers
trans-unit.target: No one can manage the entire Terran Alliance alone, no matter how competent. With the appropriate infrastructure, [HS=HS_Leaders]Leaders[/HS] can now be recruited. Every applicant has strengths and weaknesses, making them more or less suitable for any role.[BR][BR][HS=HS_Leaders]Leaders[/HS] can serve as [HS=HS_Governor]Governors[/HS] and manage a [HS=HS_CoreWorld]Core World[/HS], become [HS=HS_Diplomat]Diplomats[/HS] (if contact is made with other groups), and, importantly, they can serve as [HS=HS_Minister]Ministers[/HS]. Each ministry office has an area of focus and gives a benefit based on a Leader's specific skill.[BR][BR]Recruit new [HS=HS_Leaders]Leaders[/HS] from the [ICON=Menu_Leader_Icon] [HS=HS_LeaderMenu]Leaders Menu[/HS] under the [HS=HS_RecruitmentScreen]Recruitment Screen[/HS]. [HS=HS_Leaders]Leaders[/HS] can then be assigned to new roles under the [HS=HS_MinistersScreen]Ministers Screen[/HS].[BR][BR]New Objective: Appoint 3 Ministers

trans-unit.source: You've successfully appointed several [HS=HS_Leaders]Leaders[/HS] into roles as [HS=HS_Minister]Ministers[/HS]. Their support will go a long way to assisting in exploring the galaxy, settling new planets, and the expansion of the Terran Alliance's Influence. As you recruit new [HS=HS_Leaders]Leaders[/HS] or their skills change, you can always change what role a [HS=HS_Leaders]Leader[/HS] has from the [ICON=Menu_Leader_Icon] [HS=HS_LeaderMenu]Leaders Menu[/HS].[BR][BR]There are other ways to benefit the entire Alliance. [HS=HS_Policy]Policies[/HS] are rules that can be issued to affect all colonies and fleets. To enact a [HS=HS_Policy]Policy[/HS], the appropriate [HS=HS_Tech]Tech[/HS] has to be researched in the [HS=HS_ResearchCenter]Research Center[/HS]. Research Colonial Policies to access the [ICON=Menu_CivilizationMenu_Icon] [HS=HS_CivilizationMenu]Civilization Menu[/HS] and a [HS=HS_Policy]Policies[/HS] slot.[BR][BR]Completed Objective: Appoint 3 Ministers[BR]New Objective: Research Colonial Policies

Now, a [HS=HS_Policy]Policies[/HS] can be enacted in the [ICON=Menu_CivilizationMenu_Icon] [HS=HS_CivilizationMenu]Civilization Menu[/HS].[BR][BR]Completed Objective: Appoint 3 Ministers[BR]New Objective: Enact a Policy

Their support will go a long way to assisting in exploring the galaxy, settling new planets, and the expansion of the Terran Alliance's Influence. As you recruit new [HS=HS_Leaders]Leaders[/HS] or their skills change, you can always change what role a [HS=HS_Leaders]Leader[/HS] has from the [ICON=Menu_Leader_Icon] [HS=HS_LeaderMenu]Leaders Menu[/HS].[BR][BR]There are other ways to benefit the entire Alliance. [HS=HS_Policy]Policies[/HS] are rules that can be issued to affect all colonies and fleets. The appropriate [HS=HS_Tech]Tech[/HS] is already unlocked by researching Colonial Policies. Now, a [HS=HS_Policy]Policies[/HS] can be enacted in the [ICON=Menu_CivilizationMenu_Icon] [HS=HS_CivilizationMenu]Civilization Menu[/HS].[BR][BR]Completed Objective: Appoint 3 Ministers[BR]New Objective: Enact a Policy

trans-unit.source: Research complete! Now that you've finished researching the Colonial Pollicies [HS=HS_Tech]Tech[/HS], you have gained access to the [ICON=Menu_CivilizationMenu_Icon] [HS=HS_CivilizationMenu]Civilization Menu[/HS] and [HS=HS_Policy]Policies[/HS].[BR][BR]Under the [ICON=Menu_CivilizationMenu_Icon] [HS=HS_CivilizationMenu]Civilization Menu[/HS], you can get a high-level overview of the Alliance. You can check overall Approval, Civilization Outputs, and more. The [ICON=Menu_CivilizationMenu_Icon] [HS=HS_CivilizationMenu]Civilization Menu[/HS] also gives access to Civilization [HS=HS_Policy]Policies[/HS]. The number of [HS=HS_Policy]Policies[/HS] that can be enacted can be increased by researching certain [HS=HS_Tech]Techs[/HS]. Try enacting a [HS=HS_Policy]Policy[/HS] now to help the Alliance operate more cohesively.[BR][BR]Completed Objective: Research Colonial Pollicies[BR]New Objective: Enact a Policy

Now that you've finished researching the Colonial Pollicies [HS=HS_Tech]Tech[/HS], you have gained access to the [ICON=Menu_CivilizationMenu_Icon] [HS=HS_CivilizationMenu]Civilization Menu[/HS] and [HS=HS_Policy]Policies[/HS].[BR][BR]Under the [ICON=Menu_CivilizationMenu_Icon] [HS=HS_CivilizationMenu]Civilization Menu[/HS], you can get a high-level overview of the Alliance. trans-unit.source: You've successfully enacted a [HS=HS_Policy]Policy[/HS]. The change will be carried out as quickly as possible![BR][BR]Keep in mind that [HS=HS_Policy]Policies[/HS] can be changed anytime during your turn to better suit changing goals or respond to specific issues.[BR][BR]Completed Objective: Enact a Policy
trans-unit.target: You've successfully enacted a [HS=HS_Policy]Policy[/HS]. The change will be carried out as quickly as possible![BR][BR]Keep in mind that [HS=HS_Policy]Policies[/HS] can be changed anytime during your turn to better suit changing goals or respond to specific issues.[BR][BR]Completed Objective: Enact a Policy

trans-unit.source: Sometimes, especially during conflict, waiting a few [HS=HS_Months]Months[/HS] for something to finish isn't an option. In those scenarios, many projects and constructions can be [HS=HS_Rush]Rushed[/HS]. [HS=HS_Rush]Rushing[/HS] costs [ICON=Stat_Credits_Icon] [HS=HS_Credit]Credits[/HS], often a good deal of them, but it will reduce the time required to complete something to 1 [HS=HS_Months]Month[/HS].[BR][BR]Some colonies are worried that conflict will take too much attention and resources. Alleviate their concerns by [HS=HS_Rush]Rushing[/HS] a planetary improvement to show them they're still remembered, and the Alliance continues to be invested in developing its worlds.[BR][BR]To [HS=HS_Rush]Rush[/HS] a Planetary Improvement, select a [HS=HS_CoreWorld]Core World[/HS] and open the Management window. Selecting any item in the Build Queue with the LEFT Mouse Button will bring up some contextual options. Among those is the [HS=HS_Rush]Rush[/HS] option. As long as you have the [ICON=Stat_Control_Icon] [HS=HS_Control]Control[/HS] and [ICON=Stat_Credits_Icon] [HS=HS_Credit]Credits[/HS] required, selecting the [HS=HS_Rush]Rush[/HS] option will [HS=HS_Rush]Rush[/HS] the specific improvement. The [HS=HS_Rush]Rush[/HS] option will be grayed out and unresponsive if you do not have the necessary resources.[BR][BR]New Objective: Rush a Planetary Improvement
trans-unit.target: Sometimes, especially during conflict, waiting a few [HS=HS_Months]Months[/HS] for something to finish isn't an option. In those scenarios, many projects and constructions can be [HS=HS_Rush]Rushed[/HS]. Alleviate their concerns by [HS=HS_Rush]Rushing[/HS] a planetary improvement to show them they're still remembered, and the Alliance continues to be invested in developing its worlds.[BR][BR]To [HS=HS_Rush]Rush[/HS] a Planetary Improvement, select a [HS=HS_CoreWorld]Core World[/HS] and open the Management window. Selecting any item in the Build Queue with the LEFT Mouse Button will bring up some contextual options. Among those is the [HS=HS_Rush]Rush[/HS] option. As long as you have the [ICON=Stat_Control_Icon] [HS=HS_Control]Control[/HS] and [ICON=Stat_Credits_Icon] [HS=HS_Credit]Credits[/HS] required, selecting the [HS=HS_Rush]Rush[/HS] option will [HS=HS_Rush]Rush[/HS] the specific improvement. The [HS=HS_Rush]Rush[/HS] option will be grayed out and unresponsive if you do not have the necessary resources.[BR][BR]New Objective: Rush a Planetary Improvement

trans-unit.source: The citizens of the Alliance will appreciate the resources invested in their work. Great job.[BR][BR]It will be essential to know that [HS=HS_Rush]Rush[/HS] can only be used once per Colony and once per [HS=HS_Shipyard]Shipyard[/HS] in a [HS=HS_Months]Month[/HS]. That is on top of the often hefty price required. [HS=HS_Rush]Rushing[/HS] is best used to gain a drastic advantage or swiftly respond to an issue.[BR][BR]Completed Objective: Rush a Planetary Improvement
trans-unit.target: The citizens of the Alliance will appreciate the resources invested in their work. Great job.[BR][BR]It will be essential to know that [HS=HS_Rush]Rush[/HS] can only be used once per Colony and once per [HS=HS_Shipyard]Shipyard[/HS] in a [HS=HS_Months]Month[/HS]. That is on top of the often hefty price required. [HS=HS_Rush]Rushing[/HS] is best used to gain a drastic advantage or swiftly respond to an issue.[BR][BR]Completed Objective: Rush a Planetary Improvement

trans-unit.source: Over time, the Alliance gains [ICON=Stat_Control_Icon] [HS=HS_Control]Control[/HS], a resource representing the ability to charm or force people to carry out specific orders. [ICON=Stat_Control_Icon] [HS=HS_Control]Control[/HS] can be spent in several ways, and one way that often costs the most is [ICON=Menu_ExecutiveOrders_Icon] [HS=HS_ExecutiveOrders]Executive Order[/HS].[BR][BR][ICON=Menu_ExecutiveOrders_Icon] [HS=HS_ExecutiveOrders]Executive Order[/HS] are abilities that happen immediately and can have various impacts. They can be beneficial in all types of scenarios. The Draft Colonists order may be the most helpful as the Alliance expands. Use an [ICON=Menu_ExecutiveOrders_Icon] [HS=HS_ExecutiveOrders]Executive Order[/HS] to help with the Alliance's current goals.[BR][BR][ICON=Menu_ExecutiveOrders_Icon] [HS=HS_ExecutiveOrders]Executive Order[/HS] are selected from the related radial option. Some will execute as soon as the usage is confirmed. Others require a target and must be directed after confirming the order. Hover the Mouse over the [ICON=Menu_ExecutiveOrders_Icon] [HS=HS_ExecutiveOrders]Executive Order[/HS] option and then use the LEFT Mouse Button to select an order.[BR][BR]New Objective: Use an Executive Order
trans-unit.target: Over time, the Alliance gains [ICON=Stat_Control_Icon] [HS=HS_Control]Control[/HS], a resource representing the ability to charm or force people to carry out specific orders. [ICON=Stat_Control_Icon] [HS=HS_Control]Control[/HS] can be spent in several ways, and one way that often costs the most is [ICON=Menu_ExecutiveOrders_Icon] [HS=HS_ExecutiveOrders]Executive Order[/HS].[BR][BR][ICON=Menu_ExecutiveOrders_Icon] [HS=HS_ExecutiveOrders]Executive Order[/HS] are abilities that happen immediately and can have various impacts.
